entry.title: WETTEST DAY IN MARCH IN ROSEBURG HISTORY
entry.summary: March 17, 2025 4:30 a.m. Sunday was the wettest day in March ever for Roseburg. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the Roseburg Regional Airport measured 3.47 inches of precipitation. The previous record rain for a day in March was 2.29 inches, set on...

entry.title: COUNTY FLOODING EVENT UPDATE
entry.summary: March 17, 2025 4:10 a.m. It was a day that will be remembered for years in Douglas County. Sunday brought flooding, mudslides, road closures, people trapped, evacuations and more. entry.title: LUNCHBOX EXPRESS TO DELIVER FREE MEALS OVER SPRING BREAK

entry.title: 48TH ANNUAL SPRING FAIR COMING LATER IN MARCH

entry.title: Flood Warning Issued for Douglas County
entry.summary: A flood warning has been issued for multiple areas of Douglas County, with potential impacts on property and travel routes. Residents are urged to exercise caution and avoid flood-prone areas, including rivers, creeks, and low-lying roads. Authorities advise against attempting to cross high water, as even shallow flooding can pose

entry.title: Annan Kolberg wins Future First Citizen award
entry.summary: Annan Kolberg was named the 2025 Future First Citizen on Wednesday evening, winning $10,000 scholarship from the Roseburg High School Foundation for her future studies.

entry.title: Avalanche Incident at Mt. Bailey Near Diamond Lake Claims Life of Bend Man
entry.summary: On Thursday, March 13, 2025, a group of skiers encountered an avalanche while skiing on the north/northwest side of Mt. Bailey within the motorized closure area. The group was the fourth of the day to participate in cat skiing at Mt. Bailey, a service provided through Diamond Lake Resort.

entry.title: Fisher named to dean's list
entry.summary: FOREST GROVE — Pacific University announced that Peyton Fisher of Winston was named to the fall 2024 dean's list. The dean's list recognizes undergraduate students with a GPA of at least 3.70 with 12 or more graded hours completed.
